title: About Me
text:
I’m a Marketing Account Manager at Patch, a digital marketing agency that provides full service marketing to cash based physical therapy, chiropractic, and more! I am currently pivoting into Marketing Strategy & Analytics. My focus and passion lies in turning messy data into clean insights that drive real business decisions.



Paid Media analysis & ROI modeling
Retention and churn risk analysis
CRM automation and reporting systems

title: Paid Media ROI Reallocation (Simulated)
text:
Question
If I have $20,000 this month, how should I reallocate across campaigns to maximize profit?


Approach (quick version)

Simulated dataset of 8 campaigns across 4 channels

ROI = (revenue - spend) / spend

Allocate $20k to the top quartile by ROI (proportional), then estimate impact


library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.2     ✔ tibble    3.3.0
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.1.0     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors

set.seed(42)
ads <- tibble(
  campaign = c("82 Sweater TikTok","61 Vest Facebook","92 Pant Instagram","32 Pant Google",
               "71 Jacket TikTok","44 Shoes Facebook","27 Hat Instagram","10 Socks Google"),
  channel  = c("TikTok","Facebook","Instagram","Google","TikTok","Facebook","Instagram","Google"),
  spend    = round(runif(8, 500, 2500), 0),
  clicks   = round(runif(8, 1500, 12000), 0)
) |>
  mutate(
    conv    = round(clicks * runif(n(), 0.01, 0.04), 0),
    aov     = round(runif(n(), 45, 120), 0),
    revenue = conv * aov,
    roi     = (revenue - spend) / spend
  ) |>
  arrange(desc(roi))

ads

# A tibble: 8 × 8
  campaign          channel   spend clicks  conv   aov revenue   roi
  <chr>             <chr>     <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>   <dbl> <dbl>
1 10 Socks Google   Google      769  11370   437   106   46322 59.2 
2 71 Jacket TikTok  TikTok     1783  11314   420    79   33180 17.6 
3 27 Hat Instagram  Instagram  1973   6354   252   100   25200 11.8 
4 32 Pant Google    Google     2161   9051   243   113   27459 11.7 
5 92 Pant Instagram Instagram  1072   6306   153    74   11322  9.56
6 82 Sweater TikTok TikTok     2330   8398   330    51   16830  6.22
7 61 Vest Facebook  Facebook   2374   8903   120    84   10080  3.25
8 44 Shoes Facebook Facebook   1538   4182    59   108    6372  3.14




Baseline summary

baseline <- ads |>
  summarise(
    campaigns   = n(),
    total_spend = sum(spend),
    total_rev   = sum(revenue),
    avg_roi     = mean(roi)
  )
baseline

# A tibble: 1 × 4
  campaigns total_spend total_rev avg_roi
      <int>       <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>
1         8       14000    176765    15.3




Reallocate $20k to top quartile by ROI

alloc <- 20000

# top quartile of campaigns by ROI (use nrow(), not n())
top_q <- ads |> slice_head(n = ceiling(nrow(ads) / 4))

# proportional weights by ROI within top quartile
weights <- top_q$roi / sum(top_q$roi)

top_alloc <- top_q |>
  mutate(
    add_spend = round(alloc * weights, 0),
    proj_rev  = revenue + add_spend * (1 + roi)
  )

proj <- ads |>
  anti_join(top_q, by = "campaign") |>
  mutate(add_spend = 0, proj_rev = revenue) |>
  bind_rows(top_alloc)

projected <- proj |>
  summarise(
    new_spend   = sum(spend + add_spend),
    new_rev     = sum(proj_rev),
    new_avg_roi = (new_rev - new_spend) / new_spend
  )
projected

# A tibble: 1 × 3
  new_spend  new_rev new_avg_roi
      <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>
1     34000 1190719.        34.0




Visual: ROI by campaign

ads |>
  ggplot(aes(x = reorder(campaign, roi), y = roi, fill = channel)) +
  geom_col() +
  coord_flip() +
  labs(x = "Campaign", y = "ROI", title = "Baseline ROI by Campaign")










Findings

Baseline average ROI: 15.31

Projected average ROI after reallocating $20k to the top quartile: 34.02



Decision
Shift $20k into the top quartile campaigns. Recheck in 2 weeks; add caps if ROI decays.


What I’d test next
Ad-set holdouts, creative rotation cadence, and channel-level saturation checks.
